item.title: New Bruce Springsteen on the way
item.description: Bruce Springsteen fans: Your prayers for a new album have been answered.
item.ExtractedText: 'High Hopes' for new Bruce Springsteen album By Ed Payne, CNN November 25, 2013 -- Updated 0625 GMT (1425 HKT) Bruce Springsteen and Steven Van Zandt perform July 14, 2012, in London. STORY HIGHLIGHTS Springsteen has sold more than 64 million albums The title track is being released on iTunes Monday There are 12 tunes on "High Hopes" This is the first new album from "The Boss" since 2012's "Wrecking Ball" (CNN) -- Bruce Springsteen fans: Your prayers for a new album have been answered. "High Hopes" is set for a January 14, 2014, release. The title track comes out Monday. The news came via Springsteen's official Facebook page and Twitter account . It's the first new album from "The Boss" since 2012's "Wrecking Ball." Honoree Bruce Springsteen performs onstage at MusiCares Person Of The Year Honoring Bruce Springsteen on Friday, February 8, 2013, in Los Angeles. Host John Stewart and Springsteen goof around onstage. Left to right: Musicians Faith Hill, Garry Tallent, Sting, Ted Dwane, Ken Casey, Ben Lovett, Springsteen, Jim James, Tom Morello, Zac Brown and Ben Harper perform onstage. Springsteen pauses during his acceptance speech. Singer Patti Smith waves to the audience during her performance of "Because the Night." Left to right: Musicians Ben Lovett, Marcus Mumford, "Country" Winston Marshall and Ted Dwane of Mumford & Sons perform "I'm on Fire." Singer Kenny Chesney performs "One Step Up." Elton John performs "Streets of Philadelphia." Ben Harper and Natalie Maines perform "Atlantic City" with Charles Musselwhite (not pictured). Actor Johnny Depp and Marcus Mumford of Mumford & Sons attend the Musicares gala. Zac Brown and singer Mavis Staples duet on "My City of Ruins." Singer Faith Hill, actor Sean Penn and singer Tim McGraw pose on the red carpet. Musician Tom Morello performs. Tom Morello, Zac Brown, Emmylou Harris, Ben Harper, Jackson Browne and Patti Scialfa perform onstage. Neil Young performs "Born in the USA." Springsteen gestures during his acceptance speech. Sting, Ken Casey, Ted Dwane, Ben Lovett, Tim McGraw and Springsteen perform together. Springsteen and Patti Scialfa perform onstage. MusiCares honors Bruce Springsteen
